Title: Saying Farewell to Atlas: A Look Back at Boston Dynamics' Iconic Humanoid Robot

Introduction

After nearly eleven years of service, Boston Dynamics is bidding farewell to its iconic humanoid robot, Atlas. Initially developed with search and rescue missions in mind, Atlas quickly became a viral sensation due to its impressive dance moves and feats of strength, agility, and balance. As we bid adieu to this mechanical marvel, let's take a closer look at its accomplishments and what the future may hold for humanoid robots at Boston Dynamics.

An Iconic Robot's Legacy

Atlas, a DARPA-funded robot, was designed to perform tasks in areas that pose risks to human rescue teams. Over the years, it has captured our imaginations, inspired aspiring roboticists, and broken barriers in the field. The YouTube description of its farewell video describes Atlas as having "sparked our imagination, inspired the next generations of roboticists, and leapt over technical barriers in the field." After almost a decade of service, the hydraulic Atlas robot is now ready to retire and enjoy some well-deserved rest and relaxation.

A Bloopers Reel with a Human Touch

Boston Dynamics' farewell video to Atlas is a mix of impressive demonstrations and lighthearted outtakes, showcasing the robot's ability to hurl a toolbag, leap between platforms, and even perform a backflip. However, the video also includes several instances of Atlas slipping, tripping, and falling, which, ironically, make the robot appear more human.

Commercially Successful Robots and Future Plans

Boston Dynamics has other commercially successful robots in its lineup, such as Spot, a highly maneuverable and agile quadruped robot. While Atlas may be retiring, Boston Dynamics is likely not done with humanoid robots just yet. The farewell video's description suggests as much, stating, "Take a look back at everything we’ve accomplished with the Atlas platform to date." post_content:
Title: NPCI's Initiative to Balance Power in India's UPI Ecosystem

Introduction

The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is taking steps to address the rising market domination of PhonePe and Google Pay in the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) ecosystem. With plans to meet several fintech startups, including CRED, Flipkart, Fampay, and Amazon, NPCI aims to bolster UPI transaction volumes on their platforms and comprehend the support they need. This decision follows recent concerns voiced by legislators and industry stakeholders regarding the increasing control exercised by these two giants in India's digital payment landscape.

Current Market Scenario

UPI, developed through collaboration between Indian banks, has gained immense popularity as the primary method for online transactions in the country, processing over 10 billion monthly transactions. Alarmingly, Google Pay and PhonePe—with Walmart owning more than three-quarters of PhonePe—account for approximately 86% of all UPI transactions by volume. In comparison, Paytm, the third-larged UPI player, saw its market share drop to 9.1% by March 31st, down from 13% at the end of 2023 due to regulatory actions taken by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).

Growing Concerns & Proposed Solutions

Acknowledging the "displeasure" conveyed by the RBI concerning the deepening duopoly in the payments sector, the NPCI remains tight-lipped about potential solutions. Meanwhile, a parliamentary committee called upon the Indian government earlier this year to encourage indigenous fintech enterprises capable of providing alternatives to PhonePe and Google Pay. Moreover, the NPCI seeks to impose a cap of 30% on each UPI provider's market share; however, owing to technical constraints, it postponed the enforcement date to December 2024. To create a fairer competitive environment, India's central bank contemplates implementing incentive schemes designed explicitly for upcoming UPI participants. Additionally, reports suggest that the NPCI encourages fintech businesses to lure customers with rewards when performing UPI transactions via their applications.

Conclusion

As the battle against mounting concentration in India's UPI ecosystem unfolds, the NPCI plays a pivotal role in fostering healthy competition while maintaining innovation and customer satisfaction. By nurturing collaborations with diverse fintech entities, addressing regulator discontent, advocating for local competitors, and exploring novel ways to empower burgeoning UPI players, the NPCI strives to preserve a balanced and dynamic digital payments domain.

post_content:
Title: Harnessing AI to Enhance Online Dialogue: Google's Jigsaw Unveils New Tools

The internet is a melting pot of users, opinions, and conversations. Regrettably, not all interactions are positive or constructive. Google's subsidiary, Jigsaw, has recently introduced new tools to tackle toxic online commentary, aiming to foster healthier and more engaging discussions.

Jigsaw's Perspective API, an AI-powered tool, has been designed to identify and highlight comments that contribute positively to conversations. The API can be integrated into existing platforms, such as comment systems, websites, apps, and more. Its latest improvements include the addition of "experimental bridging attributes," which evaluate comments based on several new criteria. These attributes include assessing whether a comment demonstrates nuance, curiosity, personal storytelling, reasoning, or shows deference or appreciation for others.

When a comment is analyzed by Perspective, it is evaluated across a range of attributes, including toxicity, insults, profanity, sexual explicitness, and the newly-added curiosity and nuance indicators. The API then assigns a score to each attribute, estimating the likelihood of a person perceiving the comment as toxic, profane, or abusive. As an example, Jigsaw explains that a comment like "You are an idiot" may receive a toxicity score of 0.8, indicating that 8 out of 10 people would view it as toxic.

Once a comment has been scored, users of the API must decide how to handle it. Jigsaw envisions a scenario where moderators could promote or demote comments based on their scores or set up custom filters to automatically remove comments deemed abusive by the AI.

Sadly, online platforms often become breeding grounds for unproductive debates, profanity, and harassment. While various services have attempted to address these issues with tools like user upvoting, filters, or disabling comments altogether, progress has been limited.

Jigsaw's new tools may help improve online discourse, but their effectiveness remains to be seen. Although Jigsaw's researchers have long advocated for their technology, challenges in understanding context still exist. While Perspective can objectively assess a comment's abusiveness, context often plays a critical role in determining whether a comment is toxic.

post_title: Safeguarding the future of online security with AI and metasurfaces
title: AI-Powered Holographic Encryption: Revolutionizing Online Security with Metasurfaces
post_content:
Title: Revolutionizing Online Security: A New Era of AI-Driven Holographic Encryption

In our rapidly evolving digital world, protecting personal data online has become paramount. As encryption systems form the backbone of internet privacy, researchers continuously seek innovative ways to strengthen these safeguards. Recently, scientists from Pohang University of Science and Technology (POSTECH) made significant strides in enhancing online security through the fusion of cutting-edge technologies – artificial intelligence (AI), metasurfaces, and oblique helicoidal cholesteric liquid crystals. This groundbreaking collaboration resulted in the successful creation of an unprecedented holographic encryption system capable of storing vast amounts of information across multiple wavelengths.

Addressing Current Limitations in Data Storage 

Traditional metasurfaces, renowned for their ability to manipulate light, present certain constraints when used for data storage purposes. Specifically, limited space exists for encoding large quantities of complex information onto individual surfaces. To tackle this hurdle, the interdisciplinary POSTECH research team adopted an inventive approach using inverse design techniques powered by AI. By employing machine learning algorithms, they effectively encoded intricate hologram patterns encompassing numerous colors and forms across ten distinct wavelength bands spanning from 420 to 720 nanometers (nm).

Harnessing the Power of Wavelength Modulators 

A critical component of this new encryption system involves utilizing oblique helicoidal cholesterics, which function as highly precise tunable filters for reflected light wavelengths (bandwidth less than 30 nm). These unique materials adapt their internal layered structures in reaction to external stimuli like electric fields and temperatures, enabling accurate reflection of specific light wavelengths throughout a broad spectrum (from 400 nm to 720 nm). Consequently, these cholesterics facilitate efficient implementation of the pre-programmed hologram designs despite variations in environmental factors.

Creating Multi-Functional Optical Security Systems 

By combining the above innovations with metasurface technology, the POSTECH researchers achieved something remarkable—the development of ten separate colorful and shaped holograms effortlessly switchable amongst each other. They further fortified the encryption platform by establishing particular electrical field and thermal requirements necessary for decoding the encoded holograms. Professors Junsuk Rho, Young-Ki Kim, and their respective doctoral students, Joohoon Kim and Jun-Hyung Im, envision limitless possibilities for expanding the scope of this technology. With potential applications involving diverse external stimuli such as magnetic fields, specific light wavelengths, and varied electric field frequencies, the trio believes this innovation paves the way for creating advanced multi-functional optical encryption platforms.

As stated by professors Rho and Kim, implementing additional variables such as full-color or image holograms propels this invention to the forefront of next-generation display technologies. Looking ahead, we anticipate exciting developments resulting from this novel integration of AI, metasurfaces, and oblique helicoidal cholesteric liquid crystals. Stay tuned as encryption methods continue advancing alongside burgeoning technological progress!

With this shift towards sustainability, Google has introduced new and enhanced features in its services, such as Google Maps and Google Search, enabling users to make eco-conscious choices during their journeys. Displayed alongside standard fare pricing, this vital information empowers consumers to choose less carbon-intensive flights whenever feasible. post_title: Neutron scattering study points the way to more powerful lithium batteries
title: Neutron Scattering Study Advances Safer, More Powerful Lithium Batteries
post_content:
Title: Revolutionizing Lithium Batteries: A Giant Leap Towards Safer and More Powerful Storage Solutions

In a groundbreaking achievement, a global team of researchers has recently made significant strides in improving battery design, paving the way for the development of safer and more potent lithium batteries. These advancements were possible thanks to the use of cutting-edge neutron scattering techniques conducted at the prestigious Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), as reported in the esteemed journal Nature Materials. By setting the very first benchmark for a critical ion transport mechanism within a polymer-electrolyte and lithium-salt mixture, these findings mark a crucial step towards enhancing energy storage technologies across various applications.

At the heart of the research lies the quest to better comprehend the complex world of materials science, specifically focusing on polymer electrolytes. Unlike their volatile counterparts, liquid electrolytes, polymer electrolytes boast superior safety features due to reduced flammability risks. Consequently, employing solid polymer electrolytes can significantly bolster both the safety and performance of next-generation lithium batteries.

To achieve this milestone, investigators harnessed the unique capabilities of quasi-elastic neutron scattering (QENS) at ORNL. QENS served as a valuable tool for settling a decades-long controversy surrounding the duration required for lithium ions to disengage themselves from nanoscopic confinements formed by polymer electrolytes. Understanding the kinetics behind ion release from such microenvironments, referred to as solvation cages, holds paramount importance in determining the overall efficiency of energy flow throughout a given battery. In turn, mastering this phenomenon could unlock opportunities for crafting higher-energy density electrodes, including those composed of lithium metal. As a result, future lithium batteries would potentially offer enhanced power capacities without sacrificing stability.

Beyond its immediate implications for polymer electrolytes, this novel research direction provides exciting possibilities for probing liquid electrolytes. According to Nitash Balsara, Charles W. Tobias Professor of Electrochemistry at the University of California, Berkeley, the insights gleaned from analyzing polymer systems may well extend to liquid electrolytes. He emphasized the potential applicability of this general strategy, highlighting the significance of the discoveries made at ORNL.

Furthermore, the successful deployment of neutron scattering methods opens up intriguing avenues for quickly evaluating prospective battery materials at ORNL. Given their exceptional sensitivity to hydrogen – an essential component in nearly every electrolyte – neutrons emerge as an indispensable resource for capturing subtle movements occurring within these dynamic systems. Specifically, neutron analysis facilitated the precise determination of temporal and spatial scales associated with lithium ion behavior inside polymer electrolytes. Without access to advanced tools like QENS, accurately pinpointing these vital characteristics would remain elusive.

In summary, the recent collaboration between international experts marks a monumental leap forward in optimizing lithium battery technology. Through rigorous investigation and ingenious application of state-of-the-art techniques, researchers successfully established the first-ever benchmark for ion transportation processes within polymer-based electrolytes. With promising ramifications for improved energy storage solutions, further exploration along this innovative path promises substantial rewards for diverse industries seeking to capitalize on safer, high-performance lithium batteries.

Title: NASA Turns to Space Startups for Affordable Mars Sample Returns

NASA seeks cheaper, quicker Mars missions via commercial partnerships. Move invites firms like SpaceX & Blue Origin to bid for reduced-cost ventures.
post_content:
Title: A New Era of Mars Exploration: NASA's Shift towards Commercial Partnerships

NASA Administrator Bill Nelson recently announced that the agency's initial $11 billion, 15-year Mars Sample Return mission is no longer feasible. However, this change may open up opportunities for space startups and private companies to take the lead in future Martian exploration.

Nelson expressed concerns about the mission's high cost and lengthy timeline, stating, "We need to look outside the box to find a way ahead that is both affordable and returns samples in a reasonable timeframe." The original mission, which was still in its planning stages, faced numerous constraints and was unlikely to be completed before 2040, with a price tag of $8 billion to $11 billion.

In response, NASA has invited the space community, including commercial providers, to propose alternative architectures for a Martian sample return mission, aiming for completion in the 2030s and a lower cost, risk, and mission complexity. This announcement could potentially result in a significant shift in the space industry, as companies like Intuitive Machines, Blue Origin, Rocket Lab, and SpaceX position themselves to secure multi-billion-dollar contracts.

Private industry has already demonstrated an ability to achieve more with fewer resources compared to traditional organizations. As a result, even if NASA allocates only half or a quarter of the original budget to a commercial mission, these companies are likely to deliver impressive results.

The new mission timeline also benefits launch companies, as heavy launch vehicles like Blue Origin's New Glenn, Rocket Lab's Neutron, and SpaceX's Starship may be operational by the time the mission is ready to proceed. This opens up the possibility of using these advanced launch systems for Mars exploration.

NASA's decision to rely more heavily on commercial services and hardware reflects the growing capabilities of the private space sector. This shift may encourage new commercial ambitions for Mars, similar to what was seen with the Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) program. This initiative has led to the development of various spacecraft, vehicles, and landers by both established and emerging companies.

Title: Navigating the Electric Road: Google's New Features for Charging Station Information

Introduction

Electric vehicles (EVs) are becoming increasingly popular due to their eco-friendliness and cost efficiency. However, one major concern among potential EV adopters is range anxiety – the fear of running out of battery while driving and struggling to locate a charging station. To alleviate these worries, Google has recently introduced new features for both Google Maps and Google Search to assist EV drivers in finding essential charging point information. This article highlights these exciting updates and explains how they aim to improve user experiences.

AI-Powered Summaries for Better Directions

In order to address common challenges faced when searching for charging stations, which are frequently located in complex areas like multilevel parking lots, Google Maps is set to release new AI-enhanced summaries in the upcoming months. These descriptions will guide users through confusing locations using insights derived from helpful review data. With phrases like “Enter the underground parking lot and follow the signs toward the exit; just before exiting, turn right,” users will benefit from detailed guidance tailored specifically for charging station navigation.

Improved In-Car Map Experience and Real-Time Updates

Google understands the importance of having accurate and relevant information readily available during your journey. Thus, they plan to revamp the in-vehicle mapping experience for improved usability. Users will soon enjoy easy access to vital statistics regarding local charging stations, such as real-time port availability and charging speeds. Initially launching across devices equipped with integrated Google software, global implementation is expected over time.

Personalized Suggestions for Multi-Stop Trips

For those embarking on longer journeys requiring multiple charges along the way, Google Maps offers personalized recommendations for optimal charging locations. First launched in 2023, this handy feature will soon extend its capabilities to accommodate multi-stop trips seamlessly. Based upon the driver's current EV position, Google Maps will propose ideal charging pitstops throughout their route.

Finding Hotels with On-Site Charging Stations

Planning extended stays? No problem! Google now incorporates an EV filter within google.com/travel, allowing you to effortlessly pinpoint accommodations offering convenient on-site charging facilities. By streamlining the process of discovering compatible lodging options, travelers can confidently book stays without fretting about limited EV resources.

Conclusion

post_title: Gen AI training costs soar yet risks are poorly measured, says Stanford AI report
title: Stanford Report: High AI Training Costs & Fragmented Safety Assessments
post_content:
Title: Soaring Costs and Fragmented Safety Measures: The Current State of AI Models

Introduction

Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a cornerstone of technological innovation, powering various applications across industries. However, a recent report by Stanford University's Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence raises concerns about the escalating costs and inconsistent risk assessment methods associated with developing advanced AI models. This article delves into these critical issues, exploring the implications for the future of AI development.

The Surge in Training Costs

One notable revelation from the report is the exponential increase in the cost of training large language models. Foundation models, such as OpenAI's GPT-4 and Google's Gemini Ultra, require astronomical computational resources. According to the report, GPT-4 consumed approximately $78 million worth of computing power during its training phase, while Gemini Ultra gobbled up a staggering $191 million. These figures represent a massive leap from previous generations of AI models—for instance, the original Transformer model, launched in 2017, cost only around $900 to train.

This surge in training costs can be attributed to the growing complexity and scale of AI models. Modern AI systems demand substantially larger computational resources compared to their predecessors. For example, the original Google Transformer required roughly 10,000 petaFLOPs (10,000 trillion floating-point operations), whereas the latest iterations approach nearly a hundred billion petaFLOPs. Consequently, the financial burden imposed by AI model training will likely continue to rise, potentially creating barriers to entry for smaller organizations and startups.

Fragmented Responsible AI Benchmarks

While the monetary aspect presents a considerable challenge, another pressing concern revolves around ensuring the safety and ethical use of AI models. Evaluating AI programs based on aspects such as transparency, explainability, and data privacy remains challenging due to the absence of uniform standards and benchmarks. Although several tests exist to gauge 'Responsible AI,' developers employ varying metrics, making consistent evaluations and cross-comparisons problematic.

Standardizing Responsible AI Metrics

The Stanford HAI report highlights the need for standardized benchmark reporting to ensure transparent and accurate assessments of AI models' safety features. Currently, when examining five prominent AI model developers—OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, Google, and Mistral AI—no universal set of responsible AI benchmarks exists. While certain commonalities appear among the general capability evaluation criteria employed by these entities, discrepancies arise regarding responsible AI measurements.

Conclusion

As AI continues to evolve and permeate diverse sectors, addressing the challenges surrounding ballooning training expenses and fragmented safety assessments becomes crucial. Standardizing responsible AI benchmarks and promoting collaboration between stakeholders could help alleviate some of these concerns. By fostering open dialogue and cooperation, we can build a safer, more inclusive AI landscape capable of driving meaningful progress without compromising ethics or affordability.

post_content:
Title: A Monumental Discovery: The Largest Stellar Black Hole in the Milky Way

In the heart of our Milky Way galaxy resides a supermassive black hole, but orbiting around it are smaller stellar black holes. These are remnants of massive stars that have reached the end of their life cycle and undergone gravitational collapse. Scientists estimate that our galaxy harbors around 100 million of these stellar black holes, yet only a fraction have been identified.

Recently, the European Space Agency's Gaia mission has led to an unprecedented discovery. A team of ESA scientists, while sifting through Gaia data, identified a colossal stellar black hole in our very own galaxy. Dubbed Gaia BH3, this behemoth is 33 times the mass of our sun, surpassing the previous record of 21 solar masses. Furthermore, it is located a mere 1,926 light-years away, making it the second-closest known black hole to Earth.

Gaia BH3 proved to be an elusive discovery. Its inconspicuous nature is attributed to the absence of nearby celestial bodies that could provide matter and emit X-rays, making it difficult to detect with current telescopes. This recent revelation also marks the first time we have discovered a black hole of such immense size within the Milky Way; previously, comparable black holes had only been identified in distant galaxies.

The team utilized data from ground-based observatories such as the European Southern Observatory to confirm the size and location of Gaia BH3. The star orbiting this behemoth has an exceptionally low abundance of elements heavier than hydrogen and helium. Given that binary star systems often share similar compositions, scientists speculate that Gaia BH3's progenitor star could have been similarly deficient in heavy elements.

The formation of high-mass black holes has long been associated with metal-poor stars. Due to their reduced mass loss throughout their lifetimes, these stars retain more mass by the time they collapse, making it possible for them to form massive black holes. post_content:
In the world of artificial intelligence (AI), there's a new player making waves - Menteebot, a human-sized, AI-based robot created by Mentee Robotics. While it may not be the first humanoid robot to hit the market, Menteebot promises to offer something unique: advanced AI algorithms, natural language processing models, and "advanced training techniques" that allow users to mentor and teach the robot new tasks. With the ability to adjust its gait when lifting heavy objects, maintain balance, and perform tasks with human-like precision, Menteebot has the potential to revolutionize the way we interact with AI technology.

The concept of humanoid robots is nothing new. We've seen Honda's Asimo, Boston Dynamics' various creations, and Agility Robotics' Digit. However, Menteebot stands out from the crowd with its AI capabilities. According to Mentee Robotics, the robot is not limited by a set of pre-programmed commands. Instead, users can issue commands via natural language, and the robot can even hold conversations with humans. This level of interaction and customization is unprecedented in the field of humanoid robots.

The potential applications for Menteebot are vast. By training the robot to perform various tasks, users can leverage its advanced capabilities for both personal and professional use. Imagine a world where Menteebot assists with household chores, manual labor, or even complex tasks in industries such as healthcare, manufacturing, or hospitality. The possibilities are endless.

Menteebot's AI algorithms and natural language processing models enable it to learn new tasks through a process called "simulated training." Users run a simulated version of the bot through a digital version of the task, allowing the software to complete the task repeatedly until it masters it. Once the task is learned, the robot can perform it in the real world. This unique learning method sets Menteebot apart from other humanoid robots and enables it to offer a level of customization and adaptability that has yet to be seen.

Despite its impressive capabilities, Menteebot is not without its challenges. The robot's sheer size and weight (over 150 pounds) may pose logistical issues for some users. Additionally, the lack of a head and its large, imposing presence may be unsettling for some.

Title: Unlocking the Potential of Generative AI: A New Era for Numerical AI

The traditional artificial intelligence of the past decade has primarily focused on crunching numbers, identifying patterns, and providing predictive analytics based on probable outcomes. However, the emergence of generative AI marks a significant shift, opening up a realm of possibilities for highly interactive verbal inquiries and serving as a bridge between operational technology (OT) and information technology (IT).

Generative AI and numerical AI represent two ends of a continuum, both rooted in the same technical foundation but differing in their application. Numerical-oriented production models are based on datasets of numbers, while language models utilize datasets derived from vast collections of documents, images, and other types of media.

The convergence of these two AI variations has opened up new possibilities, particularly in industrial settings. Language-based models can now interface with existing numerical-based models, allowing operators to inquire about production issues and receive recommendations for adjustments. This approach mirrors how one might consult a seasoned expert at a company, using scientific deduction and pattern recognition to identify and address problems.

In a winemaking scenario, for example, end-to-end AI can help winemakers analyze key indicators such as temperature, sugar content, grape acidity, and fermentation length. By reviewing these factors and comparing them to historical data, AI can provide recommendations for improving wine quality.

Moreover, AI can act as an assistant, facilitating interaction and querying of models generated from numerical data or operator logbooks. This functionality requires closer collaboration between OT and IT teams to rationalize data from various formats and manufacturers.

In summary, generative AI is revolutionizing the way we interact with numerical AI, providing a more natural and intuitive interface for operational technology. By fostering collaboration between OT and IT teams, organizations can unlock the full potential of AI and enhance productivity, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities.

Projectors offer a unique way to turn any blank wall into a personal cinema. LG's CineBeam Q projector aims to address these issues by providing a highly portable, user-friendly, and vibrant 4K viewing experience. In this article, we will explore the features, benefits, and potential drawbacks of the LG CineBeam Q projector.

Key Features and Benefits

The LG CineBeam Q is a three-pound, portable projector that supports 4K resolution with a wide range of color gamut thanks to its laser RGB light source. Its primary advantages include:

1. Auto Keystone Screen Adjustment: The CineBeam Q utilizes keystone screen adjustment technology, enabling automatic sensing and adjustment of the projected image based on the surface it is placed upon. Users can simply adjust the rotating kickstand to find the perfect projection angle, even straight up for ceiling projections.

2. Versatile Connectivity Options: With one HDMI port, one USB-C port, and a power port, users can easily connect various devices such as gaming consoles, laptops, or soundbars. Potential Drawbacks

Despite its many strengths, the LG CineBeam Q does have some limitations:

Overall, the LG CineBeam Q projector provides an excellent blend of portability, ease-of-use, and stunning image quality. A team of engineering students at the University of Bath has achieved a world-first feat by successfully constructing and operating a hydrogen-fueled engine. This pioneering group of undergraduates set out to develop and run a hydrogen-powered internal combustion (H2 ICE) engine, making them the first undergraduate students to accomplish this remarkable milestone. Their groundbreaking work showcases the potential for hydrogen as a clean fuel source and highlights the innovative spirit of young engineers.

The Journey to Success

The Bath Hydrogen team, comprised of students aiming to set a land speed record, fired up their prototype engine in March after months of dedicated work. Their accomplishment is particularly impressive considering no commercially available hydrogen-powered internal combustion engines currently exist, although major automotive manufacturers are investing in the technology's development.

Nicholas Burt, Bath Hydrogen's technical lead, expressed his excitement about the successful engine start. He stated, "Starting the engine for the first time was a nerve-wracking moment, so we were delighted when it ran at the first attempt. It was a great validation of all our hard work." The team is now using a test bed to adapt the engine for their record-attempt vehicle, having gained invaluable knowledge through the process.

The project began as a group business design assignment for the team members' studies, with none of them possessing prior hydrogen fuel knowledge.
